newsitem.title: ITALY: Montedison sees improved second half in '96.
newsitem.headline: Montedison sees improved second half in '96.

text.p: Italian agro-industrial group Montedison said it expected an improvement in results for the second half of 1996 given a positive trend in revenues seen between May and August.
Montedison said in a statement a widening of its product base in certain sectors, like energy, starch, sugar and fluoride products, would add to an improvement in second half results.
It also expected a fall in debt and financial charges due to income of 448 billion in tax credits in July and August.
The group could also have gains stemming from out of court settlements with former managers, it said.
